item.title: Tony add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "The problem with socialism is that you eventually run out of other people's money." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Tony add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "Look at a day when you are supremely satisfied at the end. It's not a day when you lounge around doing nothing; it's a day you've had everything to do and you've done it." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Tony add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "Being powerful is like being a lady. If you have to tell people you are, you aren't." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "History doesn't repeat itself, but it does rhyme." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Tony add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "No-one would remember the Good Samaritan if he'd only had good intentions; he had money as well." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Tony add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "I always cheer up immensely if an attack is particularly wounding because I think, well, if they attack one personally, it means they have not a single political argument left." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Tony add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "I do not know anyone who has gotten to the top without hard work. That is the recipe. It will not always get you to the top, but it will get you pretty near." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Tony add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "When I'm out of politics I'm going to run a business, it'll be called rent-a-spine" -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Tony add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A person that started in to carry a cat home by the tail was gitting knowledge that was always going to be useful to him, and warn't ever going to grow dim or doubtful." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very;' your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Donâ€™t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Loyalty to country ALWAYS. Loyalty to government, when it deserves it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Books are for people who wish they were somewhere else." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Sanity and happiness are an impossible combination." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Sometimes I wonder whether the world is being run by smart people who are putting us on or by imbeciles who really mean it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The most interesting information come from children, for they tell all they know and then stop." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I didn't have time to write a short letter, so I wrote a long one instead." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Heaven goes by favor. If it went by merit, you would stay out and your dog would go in." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Abraham Maslow
item.description: "I suppose it is tempting, if the only tool you have is a hammer, to treat everything as if it were a nail." -- Abraham Maslow

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The human race has only one really effective weapon and that is laughter." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tony add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Man is the only animal that blushes. Or needs to." -- Mark Twain
